title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a customizable dashboard and organizational tool. Leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and management, Devboard showcases a modern tech stack and explores best practices in building responsive, type-safe web applications. This repository demonstrates concepts related to component architecture, state management, and API integration within the Next.js framework.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed as a project focused on visualizing and interacting with data from a robofleet system. This dashboard aims to provide users with a clear and intuitive way to monitor robot status, manage tasks, and analyze performance metrics within a robotic fleet.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing common dashboard features, providing a solid foundation for building complex web applications with a focus on clean architecture and type safety. This project aims to demonstrate best practices for structuring a Next.js application with TypeScript, emphasizing maintainability and scalability.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for clean formatting and potentially converted to HTML for online viewing. It serves as a project showcasing my skills in document preparation and web development using TeX and HTML technologies.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to be a simple and intuitive platform for capturing, organizing, and prioritizing ideas. This repository provides a clean and interactive workspace for brainstorming, project planning, and general idea management, allowing users to visually structure their thoughts and easily track the progression of their concepts.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The `sleep-debt-tracker` repository hosts a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This tool likely provides features for logging sleep hours, calculating sleep debt based on user-defined goals, and potentially visualizing sleep patterns. Focused on practical application, the project showcases the use of TypeScript in building a functional web application.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS) to facilitate simple and efficient online voting. This project leverages modern web development practices and aims to provide a user-friendly platform for creating and participating in polls, covering topics related to project implementation and online voting systems.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built using Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project demonstrates the creation of a dynamic web application with features for creating, reading, updating, and deleting data, showcasing a practical implementation of backend logic with Flask and database interaction with PostgreSQL, along with a functional user interface.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations created using HTML and Python. This repository contains code for generating and displaying maps, potentially with features like data overlays, interactive elements, and custom styling. It serves as a demonstration and learning resource for map-based data presentation and exploration within a web environment.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a modern IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. It leverages Supabase for backend services and focuses on providing a user-friendly interface for real-time asset monitoring, location tracking, and data visualization. It serves as a project template for developing similar IoT solutions.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a fully interactive and customizable event calendar built using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository provides a flexible framework for displaying and managing events dynamically, allowing users to easily visualize schedules and organize important dates. The project emphasizes clean code, modular design, and user-friendly interaction, making it a valuable resource for learning front-end development techniques and implementing event calendar functionality in web applications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Python scripts focused on applying practical financial analysis and modeling techniques. The projects explore various topics within finance, potentially including portfolio optimization, risk management, time series analysis, and financial data visualization, providing a hands-on learning experience for leveraging Python in the financial domain.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, providing a user-friendly interface to identify and debug issues in robotic systems. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project allows users to easily filter, search, and display log data, making it a valuable asset for ROS developers and researchers for efficient project debugging and monitoring.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js, leveraging the Gemini API to provide engaging and intelligent conversational experiences. This project explores the integration of large language models for interactive communication, utilizing a modern frontend with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and a robust backend for API handling and data management.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with Material UI (MUI). This repository showcases a functional online store for selling fruits, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and management, and emphasizing strong type safety throughout the codebase. It's a practical demonstration of modern web development techniques and best practices for building performant and scalable e-commerce applications.
